
The admin encrypted two secrets but reused the same prime in both RSA keys. Here are the ciphertexts: 2612910846637711340243533358356252469871676060245216708507972861341643391423351836572244306324980744681340131764315496637447456965729509415436933333881283. Can you recover the message?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=3666497331181162042887906206282871947481791992841384819278122658935732460689961568675675172322817252256783664999553829595623896344970083913033082587634769, e=3563310797077391202656218694651139643287429647234832898041603984746993117433421991917160421802347012990363086870244433168524878242300657643503180524125925

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{k0lx03zv}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2612910846637711340243533358356252469871676060245216708507972861341643391423351836572244306324980744681340131764315496637447456965729509415436933333881283
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=3666497331181162042887906206282871947481791992841384819278122658935732460689961568675675172322817252256783664999553829595623896344970083913033082587634769, e=3563310797077391202656218694651139643287429647234832898041603984746993117433421991917160421802347012990363086870244433168524878242300657643503180524125925
extra_info: p=60551608824053238716832804560544783783085744459352718962650580604782736015863, q=60551608824053238716832804560544783783085744459352718962650580604782736015863, Ï†(n)=3666497331181162042887906206282871947481791992841384819278122658935732460689840465458027065845383586647662575431987658106705190907044782751823517115603044
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
archetype: rsa
